newsitem.title: USA: IBM to buy majority stake in NetObjects.
newsitem.headline: IBM to buy majority stake in NetObjects.

text.p: International Business Machines Corp and NetObjects Inc said Wednesday IBM plans to buy a majority stake in NetObjects, a privately held supplier of software used by businesses to build Internet Web sites.
IBM said the investment reflects its strategy to champion leading Internet technologies that help businesses exploit network computing.
NetObjects, headed by Chairman and Chief Executive Samir Arora, said it will continue to operate as an independent company that supports leading platforms and standards.
NetObjects has partnerships with other computer industry leaders including AT&T Corp, Microsoft Corp, Netscape Communications Corp, Sun Microsystems Inc and WorldCom Inc's UUNET.
Michael Zisman, executive vice president at Lotus, will join NetObjects board and will represent IBM's interests.
The original investors, the management team and employees of NetObjects will retain investment interests.
No further details of the transaction were disclosed.
